suspicious
activities Amazon guard duty is a threat

threat detection capabilities guard Duty
continuously monitors different log

and prioritize potential security risk
malicious activities in your environment
these log sources include AWS cloud
trail management events that helps
customers find anomalous activity
associated with I IM rolles VPC flow
logs to detect communication with known
command and control servers Crypt mining
pools DNS logs to detect resources
reaching out to malicious domains
kubernetes audit logs to Det protect
suspicious kubernetes Behavior such as
launching privileged containers or
successful Anonymous access rdn RDS
login activity to detect suspicious
login activity with RDS S3 data events
to detect potential data exfiltration
EBS volumes to determine the presence of
malware runtime monitoring where guard
Duty can see process execution and
kernel level details to see activity
like malicious Library loads or
processed injection activity and Lambda
network activity logs to determine when
Lambda is communicating with a malicious
actor these are just some of the
examples from each of the different data
